Title: Chisholm versus Lindsay
Paragraphs: On April 22, 2005 just before noon, the Plaintiff, Ms. Chisholm, was sitting in her vehicle in the driver’s seat, eating her lunch. The vehicle was parked in a designated parking spot at a shopping centre, the engine was off and she was not wearing her seatbelt. There were vehicles parked in front of her and on either side of her vehicle. Her vehicle was struck from behind by the Defendant’s vehicle (Ms. Lindsay). The force of that collision caused her vehicle to strike the vehicle parked in front of her and then strike the vehicle to the right of her.
